name: Roche Noires Beach
description: A serene beach known for its black rocks and clear waters, offering a unique contrast to the typical white-sand beaches of Mauritius. Ideal for photography, picnics, and enjoying tranquil sunsets.

entry_points.name: Public Access Path
entry_points.access_notes: Leads directly to the beach; watch for uneven terrain.

prerequisites.notes: Limited facilities; best to bring your own supplies.

reviews.summary: Beautiful and peaceful; great for a quiet day out.

additional_info.notes: Stunning rock formations at either end of the beach.

advisories.safety: Beware of strong currents; not ideal for swimming.

name: Roches Noires Waterfront
description: Scenic coastal area with rocky outcrops and clear waters, popular for photography and enjoying the natural beauty of the East Coast.

entry_points.name: Coastal Path Access
entry_points.access_notes: Path leads to rocky areas; suitable footwear recommended.

prerequisites.notes: No facilities; carry water and snacks.

reviews.summary: Picturesque and tranquil; a hidden gem.

additional_info.notes: Best visited in the late afternoon for sunset views.

advisories.safety: Slippery rocks; caution advised.

name: Bassin Tower
description: A historic tower offering panoramic views of the surrounding area, including the coastal lagoons and lush vegetation of the east.

entry_points.name: Tower Trailhead
entry_points.access_notes: Short hike from the road; moderate difficulty.

prerequisites.notes: Bring water and wear sturdy shoes.

reviews.summary: Stunning views; worth the hike.

additional_info.notes: Best visited early morning or late afternoon.

advisories.safety: Trail can be steep and uneven.

name: Gily's Barking Rock
description: A unique rock formation along the coast, known for its distinctive shape and the sound of waves echoing through it.

entry_points.name: Coastal Track Access
entry_points.access_notes: Follow the coastal track; some scrambling over rocks.

prerequisites.notes: Best visited at low tide for easier access.

reviews.summary: Interesting rock formation; nice coastal walk.

additional_info.notes: Check tide times; not accessible at high tide.

advisories.safety: Watch for slippery rocks and strong waves.

name: Mare Sacrelle Trail
description: Scenic trail leading to Mare Sacrelle, a beautiful lake known for its birdwatching and tranquil surroundings.

entry_points.name: Trailhead Parking
entry_points.access_notes: Parking available; trail starts here.

prerequisites.notes: Bring water and snacks; no facilities on the trail.

reviews.summary: Peaceful and scenic; great for nature walks.

additional_info.notes: Early morning is best for birdwatching.

advisories.safety: Trail can be muddy after rain.

name: Post Lafayette Public Beach
description: A quiet public beach with soft sand and clear water, ideal for swimming and relaxing away from the crowds.

entry_points.name: Public Access
entry_points.access_notes: Direct access from the road; parking available.

prerequisites.notes: Bring your own supplies; limited shade.

reviews.summary: Lovely beach; not too crowded.

additional_info.notes: Good snorkeling spots nearby.

advisories.safety: Watch for strong currents; swim with caution.

name: Bras D'Eau National Park
description: A protected national park featuring diverse ecosystems, including coastal mangroves, coral reefs, and woodland. Offers walking trails, birdwatching, and a glimpse of Mauritius's natural heritage.

entry_points.name: Park Entrance
entry_points.access_notes: Main entrance with parking and information.

prerequisites.notes: Wear comfortable shoes; trails can be uneven.

reviews.summary: Beautiful park with diverse wildlife; well-maintained trails.

additional_info.notes: Guided tours available; check at the visitor center.

advisories.safety: Stay on marked trails; watch for falling branches.

name: Bras D'Eau Visitor's Center
description: The main information center for Bras D'Eau National Park, offering exhibits on the park's ecology, history, and conservation. A starting point for trails and tours.

entry_points.name: Visitor Center Entrance
entry_points.access_notes: Main entrance to the visitor center.

prerequisites.notes: Restrooms and refreshments available.

reviews.summary: Informative exhibits; helpful staff.

additional_info.notes: Check for guided tour availability.

name: Mare Mahogany
description: A scenic lake in Bras D'Eau National Park, popular for birdwatching, especially for spotting the rare Mauritius Kestrel. The area around the lake features picnic spots and walking trails.

entry_points.name: Lake Access Path
entry_points.access_notes: Path leads to the lake; some areas may be muddy.

prerequisites.notes: Best visited in the early morning for birdwatching.

reviews.summary: Tranquil and scenic; great for nature lovers.

additional_info.notes: Bring binoculars for birdwatching.

advisories.safety: Watch for slippery paths; stay on marked trails.

name: Puit Français (French Well)
description: Historic stone-lined well from the colonial era, tucked inside Bras D’Eau’s woodland. Illustrates historic water sourcing.

entry_points.name: Forest Spur
entry_points.access_notes: Short spur off main walking track.

prerequisites.notes: Unmanned heritage point; respect barriers.

reviews.summary: Small but interesting; combine with a loop walk.

additional_info.notes: Good stop on a family loop.

advisories.safety: Do not lean over the well lip.

name: Bras D'Eau Public Beach
description: A small, shaded beach cove on the park’s edge. Calm waters and casuarina shade make it a relaxed local favorite.

entry_points.name: Beach Carpark
entry_points.access_notes: Small lot; fills on weekends.

prerequisites.notes: Basic facilities; bring supplies.

reviews.summary: Quiet, shady, family-friendly; limited vendors.

additional_info.notes: Great for picnics.

advisories.safety: Watch for reef cuts at low tide.

name: Bassin Requins
description: A historical site known locally as the ‘shark pool’—a rocky coastal basin with folklore around currents and marine life.

entry_points.name: Coastal Track Pull-off
entry_points.access_notes: Short scramble over lava rock.

prerequisites.notes: No facilities; wild coast feel.

reviews.summary: Atmospheric and rugged; not for swimming.

additional_info.notes: Great for photos on calm days.

advisories.safety: Beware of waves and sharp lava.

name: Constance Belle Mare Plage
description: Upscale beachfront resort precinct with golf, dining, and a long swimming beach. A base for watersports along the East Coast.

entry_points.name: Resort Entrance
entry_points.access_notes: Guest/booking check required.

prerequisites.notes: Beachfront is public by law; facilities are for guests.

reviews.summary: Highly rated service, beachfront, and golf; premium pricing.
Highly praised for its beauty, long sandy stretch, and sunrise views; can be busy on weekends.

additional_info.notes: Two championship courses nearby.

name: Belle Mare Public Beach
description: One of Mauritius’s longest white-sand beaches with a clear lagoon and casuarina shade. Popular for sunrise walks and family days.

entry_points.name: Public Parking
entry_points.access_notes: Large public area; busy on weekends.

prerequisites.notes: Vendors for snacks and gear rentals (seasonal).

reviews.summary: Gorgeous lagoon and long shoreline; arrive early for shade spots.

additional_info.notes: Excellent for morning runs.

advisories.safety: Watch currents outside the reef channel.

name: Quatres Cocos Beach Hiking Trail
description: Coastal path skirting lagoons and rustling casuarinas between Belle Mare and Palmar. Easy, scenic walking with sea breezes.

entry_points.name: North Access (Belle Mare side)
entry_points.access_notes: Beach path; sandy sections.

entry_points.name: South Access (Palmar side)
entry_points.access_notes: Join from Palmar Public Beach.

prerequisites.notes: No formal wayfinding; follow the shoreline.

reviews.summary: Easy coastal stroll; breezy and photogenic.

additional_info.notes: Best in mornings for cooler temps.

advisories.safety: Sun exposure; bring water/hat.

name: Palmar Public Beach
description: Sheltered lagoon with gentle waves and laid-back vibe south of Belle Mare. Good swimming and picnic spots.

entry_points.name: Public Car Park
entry_points.access_notes: Beach access via short path.

prerequisites.notes: Vendors on weekends; quiet weekdays.

reviews.summary: Calm waters and family vibe; shaded areas under casuarinas.
Praised for its calm waters and relaxing environment, though not as lively as Belle Mare.

additional_info.notes: Nice for sunrise swims.

advisories.safety: Beware of sea urchins near rocks.

name: Pointe Quatres Cocos
description: A picturesque headland and viewpoint between Belle Mare and Palmar with sweeping lagoon views and steady trade winds.

entry_points.name: Track from Beach Path
entry_points.access_notes: Short sandy track from shoreline.

prerequisites.notes: No facilities; exposed to wind.

reviews.summary: Wide views and great photo angles; very windy at times.

additional_info.notes: Golden light near sunrise.

advisories.safety: Stay clear of slippery rock edges.

name: Camila Plage Publique
description: Small community beach cove used mainly by locals. Calm shallows, simple vibe, and a few shaded spots.

entry_points.name: Beach Lane
entry_points.access_notes: Narrow lane; limited parking.

prerequisites.notes: No formal facilities.

reviews.summary: Quiet local spot; bring your own gear and water.

additional_info.notes: Best for a short, quiet stop.

advisories.safety: Check footing on rocky patches.

name: Public Boat Pier (Trou d'Eau Douce)
description: Main departure point for public boats and shuttles to Île aux Cerfs. Bustling in the mornings; simple ticket kiosks.

entry_points.name: Pier Entrance
entry_points.access_notes: Street parking nearby; peak-time queues.

prerequisites.notes: Boat fares vary; cash/card depending on operator.

reviews.summary: Efficient gateway to Île aux Cerfs; expect crowds at peak hours.

additional_info.notes: First boats often around 9–10am (operator dependent).

advisories.safety: Mind wet, slippery pier surfaces.

name: Beau Rivage Hunting Preserve
description: Private inland estate area historically associated with game and countryside activities. Access and activities vary by operator and season.

entry_points.name: Estate Gate (by booking)
entry_points.access_notes: Advance confirmation required.

prerequisites.notes: Activities, access, and ethics vary—verify before booking.

reviews.summary: Specialized, limited-access countryside venue.

additional_info.notes: Not a standard public attraction.

advisories.safety: Follow operator instructions strictly.

name: Île aux Cerfs
description: Famed islet with turquoise lagoons, sandbars, and watersports. Day-trippers come for beaches, parasailing, and seaside grills.

entry_points.name: Main Jetty (island side)
entry_points.access_notes: Arrivals from Trou d’Eau Douce boats.

prerequisites.notes: Food/beverage outlets on islet; prices tourist-oriented.

reviews.summary: Iconic turquoise waters and soft sands; can feel busy midday.

additional_info.notes: Best early or late to avoid crowds.

advisories.safety: Strong sun; hydrate and use reef-safe sunscreen.

name: Cervi Beach (Île aux Cerfs)
description: Powder-sand strip on the northern side of Île aux Cerfs with postcard-perfect lagoon hues.

entry_points.name: Boat from Trou d'Eau Douce
entry_points.access_notes: Boat launches from the eastern shore; public pickup boats available.

prerequisites.notes: Reach on foot from main jetty.

reviews.summary: Shallow turquoise waters; busy in high season.
A picturesque paradise with clear waters and fun water activities, but can be crowded during peak hours.

additional_info.notes: Great for photos before 10am.

advisories.safety: Mind boats in the lagoon corridors.

name: Four Seasons Beach (Anahita/Île aux Cerfs)
description: A managed beach area linked to Four Seasons at Anahita, offering calm lagoon waters and serviced loungers for resort guests.

prerequisites.notes: Primarily for hotel/partner guests; confirm access.

reviews.summary: Immaculate setup and tranquil waters; access restrictions apply.

additional_info.notes: Check shuttle timings from main resort.

name: Îlot Valérie
description: Tiny sand-and-rock islet near Île aux Cerfs used for short photo stops on lagoon cruises.

location.address: Lagoon near Île aux Cerfs, Flacq

prerequisites.notes: Access by boat only.

reviews.summary: Quick scenic stop; no facilities—pure lagoon vibes.

additional_info.notes: Tide and wind can affect sand exposure.

advisories.safety: Beware sharp coral underfoot.
